data.title: Vander Poel (Halsted) Campanian collection
data.text:
Copies of letters sent by Della Corte to unidentified recipients, 1903-1935

Physical Description: 14 letters

Scope and Contents note

Also includes typescript copy of one letter added by Vander Poel.

Letters and cards from family members and condolences on Matteo Della Corte's death, 1927-1963, undated

Physical Description: 37 letters, 56 postcards, 99 cards

Photographic copies of letters from De Franciscis concerning the sale of guidebooks, 1962

Physical Description: 2 photographs

Materials related to paper given at the Congresso nazionale di studi romani, 8 Apr 1940,

Physical Description: 48 leaves, 4 photographs, 3 drawings

Scope and Contents note

Paper later evolved into "L'albergo." Materials include typescript, list of photographs, photographs and notes.

Manuscript of early draft, entitled "A Pompei con i primitivi Cristiani,"

Physical Description: 22 leaves

Typescript of early draft, entitled "A Pompei con i primitivi Cristiani,"

Physical Description: 43 leaves

Scope and Contents note

One complete and one partial typescript; typed on verso of partial set of corrected proofs for "Le inscrizioni della Villa Giuliana..." (1940).

Pompeii. The Best Guide-Book to the Ruins, 1944

Physical Description: 3 copies, 1 cover

Scope and Contents note

Cover is for a different edition.

Inscriptiones Italiae volume on inscriptions from I 7, before 1929

Physical Description: 41 leaves

Scope and Contents note

Unpublished manuscripts of first and second drafts; material later published in a series of Notizie degli scavi di antichità reports using a different format and numeration.

"Augustus in his last visit to Campania," before 1933

Physical Description: 16 leaves

Scope and Contents note

Unpublished manuscript in English, sent to Ralph Van Deman Magoffin in 1933.

Graffiti from I 6, 8, 16 Aug 1927

Physical Description: 5 leaves

Scope and Contents note

Includes further research on names found in graffiti.

Research material on the villa of N. Popidius Florus at Boscoreale, undated

Physical Description: 1 booklet, 13 photographs, 1 ink on vellum plan, 2 pencil on vellum drawings

Scope and Contents note

Includes a privately printed (?) booklet, "La Villa de N. Popidius Florus fouillée par Mme. Zurlo-Pulzella à Boscoreale," with 12 pages of text and 16 photographs tipped in. Several photographs have been cut out of this copy.

Lily Ross Taylor, "The Worship of Augustus in Italy during his Lifetime," TAPA 51 (1920)

Physical Description: 4 leaves

Translation into Italian of entry for a fragment of a Tabula Iliaca

Physical Description: 1 leaf

Scope and Contents note

Pages 165-172 in H. S. Jones, A Catalogue of the Ancient Sculptures Preserved in the Municipal Collections of Rome: the Sculptures of the Museo Capitolino (1912).

Translations of passages from Greek and Latin texts into Italian

Physical Description: 11 leaves

Lists of photographs of Pompeii available from commercial vendors,

Physical Description: 848 items

Scope and Contents note

Lists of Alinari, Brogi, Sommer and Richter photographs.

Plans of facades along the Via dell'Abbondanza, II, v-viii and III, v-vii, undated

Physical Description: 2 sheets

List of objects sent from Pompeii to the Museo archeologico nazionale di Napoli, 2 Oct 1910

Physical Description: 2 leaves

Lists of members of foreign archaeological schools who visited the excavations at Pompeii, circa 1923-1927

Physical Description: 6 leaves

Clippings pertaining to the excavations at Pompeii, Della Corte and his colleagues, 1908-1961

Summary of presentation of Della Corte's work at the Reale accademia nazionale dei Lincei, 1923

Physical Description: 1 offprint

Scope and Contents note

Annotated.

By Pio Ciprotti from Studia et documenta historiae et iuris ,

Physical Description: 3 bound offprints

Memorial address by Veikko Väänänen from the commemoration of the centenary of Della Corte's birth, held 18 Jan 1976, 1976-1981

Physical Description: 3 leaves, 1 note, 1 offprint

Scope and Contents note

Photocopy of typescript of speech; a note from Väänänen to Vander Poel mentioning the Tatiana Warscher Fund; a signed presentation copy of an offprint of the publication of the address by Väänänen with an epilogue in Recherches et récréations latino-romanes in 1981.

Envelope that held the letters of the Russian authors, 25 Apr 1948

Physical Description: 1 envelope

Material for a revised and expanded version of the "Codex," 1960-1997

Scope and Contents note

This appears to be a mix of original material and new material collected by Vander Poel for his intended revision of the "Codex." It includes photographic copies of pages from the original "Codex," as well as pages of text and photographs. Some of the pages of text are original with Warscher's writing, while others are Vander Poel's later additions. The same holds true for the photographs. They include Warscher's original photographs, prints from commercial vendors and photographs taken or commissioned by Vander Poel.

"Compendium of Fiorelli, Pompeianarum Antiquitatum Historia, volumes I and II," undated

Physical Description: 108 leaves

Scope and Contents note

Incomplete annotated typescript of unpublished work. Vander Poel continued this project, see below Box 267.

"VI, 9, 6, Casa di Castore e Polluce," undated

Physical Description: 37 leaves

Scope and Contents note

Typescript of unpublished work.

Regio I, Insulae 1 and 2

Physical Description: 100 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains I 1, including Stabian Gate (16 photographs, including 1 duplicate print); I 2, 1 (1 photograph); I 2, 3 (14 photographs); I 2, 6 (7 photographs); I 2, 8 (1 photograph): I 2, 10 (9 photographs); I 2, 15 (2 photographs); I 2, 16 (5 photographs); I 2, 17 (3 photographs); I 2, 18 (3 photographs); I 2, 21/22 (3 photographs); I 2, 23 (1 photograph); I 2, 24 (11 photographs); I 2, 28 (20 photographs, including 3 duplicate prints); I 2, 30 (4 photographs).

Regio I, Insula 4, 5/25/28

Physical Description: 177 photographs, including 14 duplicate prints

Regio I, Insulae 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 11, 12, extra portam

Physical Description: 79 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains I 5 (20 photographs, including 3 duplicate prints); I 6 (2 photographs); I 6, 2 (3 photographs); I 6, 7 (2 photographs); I 6, 11 (4 photographs); I 6, 12 (1 photograph); I 6, 13/14 (2 photographs); I 7, 1 (5 photographs); I 7, 2/3 (1 photograph); I 7, 7 ( 1 photograph); I 7, 10-12 (21 photographs, including 1 duplicate print); I 8, 1 (5 photographs); I 8, 8 ( 1 photograph); I 10 (1 photograph); I 10, 3 (1 photograph); I 10, 4 (3 photographs, including 1 duplicate print); I 10, 7 (1 photograph); I 10, 8 (1 photograph); I 10, 11 (1 photograph); I 11, 1 (1 photograph); I 12, 3 (1 photograph); I extra portam (1 photograph).

Regio II, Insulae 1, 2, 6; Regio III, Insulae 2, 3, 4 and Regio IV, extra portam

Physical Description: 67 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains II 1, 1 (1 photograph); II 1, 2 (1 photograph); II 2, 1/6 (1 photograph); II 2, 2 (13 photographs); II 2, 3 (1 photograph); II 2, 4 (3 photographs); II 6 (8 photographs); III 2, 1 (14 photographs); III 3, 1 (1 photograph); III 3, 6 (7 photographs, including 1 duplicate print); III 4, 1 (1 photograph); III 4, 2/3 (3 photographs, including 1 duplicate print); III 4, 4 (6 photographs); Porta di Nola (2 photographs); IV extra portam (5 photographs).

Regio VI, Insula 7 and Insula 8, 5-19

Physical Description: 81 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains VI 7, 19/20 (2 photographs); VI 7, 23 (1 photograph); VI 7, 26 (2 photographs); VI 8 Arco di Caligula (2 photographs); VI 8 (2 photographs); VI 8, 5 (41 photographs, including 10 duplicate prints); VI 8, 7-9 (11 photographs); VI 8, 11 (1 photograph); VI 8, 12 (2 photographs); VI 8, 14-19 (17 photographs, including 3 duplicate prints).

Regio VI, Insula 10, 8/9/11

Physical Description: 130 photographs, including 16 duplicate prints

Regio VII, Insulae 5, 6 and 7

Physical Description: 112 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains ; VII 5 (13 photographs, including 3 duplicate prints); VII 6 (5 photographs); VII 6, 7 (2 photographs); VII 6, 24 (8 photographs); VII 6, 28 (20 photographs, including 3 duplicate prints); VII 6, 30 (1 photograph); VII 6, 34 (2 photographs); VII 6, 35 (7 photographs, including 1 duplicate print); VII 7 (2 photographs); VII 7, 5 (15 photographs); VII 7, 10/13 (13 photographs); VII 7, 16 (1 photograph); VII 7, 17 (2 photographs); VII 7, 22 (1 photograph); VII 7, 23 (1 photograph); VII 7, 26 (2 photographs); VII 7, 29, 30; (4 photographs); VII 7, 32 Temple of Apollo (13 photographs).

Regio VII, Insulae 9, 10 and 11

Physical Description: 108 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains VII 9, 1/67/68 (31 photographs); VII 9, 2 (16 photographs); VII 9, 3 (7 photographs); VII 9, 4-12 (31 photographs); VII 9, 33 (2 photographs); VII 9, 47 (6 photographs); VII 9, 63 (2 photographs); VII 10, 1-2 (2 photographs); VII 10, 5 (3 photographs); VII 11 (4 photographs); VII 11, 11/14 (4 photographs).

Regio VIII, Insulae 1, 2, 3

Physical Description: 162 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains Porta Marina (2 photographs); VIII 1, [1] (24 photographs); VIII 1, Temple of Venus (12 photographs); VIII 2 (5 photographs); VIII 2, 1 (8 photographs); VIII 2, 6/8/10 (7 photographs); VIII 2, 14-16 (15 photographs); VIII 2, 17-21 (3 photographs); VIII 2, 23 (7 photographs); VIII 2, 26 (3 photographs); VIII 2, 29 (3 photographs); VIII 2, 30 (10 photographs); VIII 2, 34 (3 photographs); VIII 2, 37 (2 photographs); VIII 2, 39 (5 photographs); VIII 3, 4 (2 photographs); VIII 3, 6 (1 photograph); VIII 3, 8 (24 photographs); VIII 3, 10-12 (1 photograph); VIII 3, 13-16 (5 photographs); VIII 3, 21 (1 photograph); VIII 3, 24 (4 photographs); VIII 3, 27-28 (3 photographs); VIII 3, 31 (11 photographs); VIII 3, 32 (1 photograph).

Regio VIII, Insulae 4, 5, 6

Physical Description: 77 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains VIII 4 (1 photograph); VIII 4, 1 (2 photographs); VIII 4, 4 (11 photographs); VIII 4, 9 (1 photograph); VIII 4, 10-12 (3 photographs); VIII 4, 15 (18 photographs); VIII 4, 26-28 (3 photographs); VIII 4, 34 (4 photographs); VIII 5, 2 (10 photographs); VIII 5, 9 (1 photograph); VIII 5, 10 (1 photograph); VIII 5, 16 (10 photographs); VIII 5, 17-20 (2 photographs, including 1 duplicate print); VIII 5, 24 (1 photograph); VIII 5, 28 (1 photograph); VIII 5, 32-34 (1 photograph); VIII 5, 37 (2 photographs); VIII 6, 4 (1 photograph); VIII 6, 9 (1 photograph); VIII 6, 10 (3 photographs including 2 duplicate prints).

Villas outside the walls and city features

Physical Description: 50 photographs

Scope and Contents note

Contains Villa di Diomede (18 photographs, including 9 duplicate prints); Villa dei Misteri (3 photographs); Villa Suburbana (2 photographs, including duplicate print); Villa delle colonne a mosaico ( 3 photographs); Boscoreale (1 photograph); city walls and gates (9 photographs); street and water features (9 photographs); inscriptions (5 photographs); magazine (2 photographs).

I 1- I 4, 5

Physical Description: 427 negatives
